title: Commemorating Robert Gangi upon the occasion of his 30-year career at the Correctional Association
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commemorating Robert Gangi upon the occasion of
his 30-year career at the Correctional Association

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to publicly  recognize
those  extraordinary  individuals  who  have  made  contributions to the
success and progress of society in the course of their life's work; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions,  this  Legislative Body is justly proud to commem-
orate Robert Gangi upon the  occasion  of  his  30-year  career  at  the
Correctional  Association,  to be celebrated on Friday, October 1, 2010;
and
  WHEREAS, Robert Gangi is stepping down as Executive  Director  and  is
being recognized for three decades of distinguished service; and
  WHEREAS,  Robert Gangi has served as Executive Director of the Correc-
tional Association (CA) for over 28 years;  he  has  been  an  activist,
community organizer and public policy advocate in New York City for over
30 years; and
  WHEREAS,  Robert Gangi is an expert on correctional issues and manages
all aspects of the CA, developing plans for research,  public  education
and  advocacy  projects,  and  managing  its  professional staff; he has
cultivated ongoing relationships with members of the  media  and  policy
makers  which  are  critical  to  the CA's advocacy and public education
efforts; and
  WHEREAS, Robert Gangi has written or co-written numerous op-ed  pieces
for THE NEW YORK TIMES, NEWSDAY and ALBANY TIMES UNION; and
  WHEREAS,  Robert  Gangi's  distinguished record merits the recognition
and respectful tribute of this Legislative Body; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commemorate  Robert Gangi upon the occasion of his 30-year career at the
Correctional Association; and to wish him continued success in  all  his
future endeavors; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Robert Gangi.
